meanings.definition: To place in a tomb or grave.
meanings.sent1: The ancient Egyptians intombs their pharaohs with great care.
meanings.sent2: After the funeral, they intombs the casket in the family plot.
meanings.sent3: The gravedigger intombs the treasure chest instead of the pirate.
meanings.sent4: She intombs her memories of him in a hidden corner of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The solemn ceremony intombs the fallen soldier with honor.

meanings.sent1: The dog intombs his bone in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: They intombs the time capsule under the school playground.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel intombs its acorns all over the yard.
meanings.sent4: The snow intombs the car in a thick blanket of white.
meanings.sent5: The landslide intombs the village under a mountain of earth.
